creator: sfhowes

content:
I am NOT versed in prior versions, I cannot provide technical assistance in this, and can only offer a possible approach. I would NOT follow my approach unless you have the ability to reinstall ver 38. Anyway, here's my thought: - exit thunderbird - do a full backup of the proflie. very important - uninstall ver 38 and install latest version of release level - set up accounts, but do NOT include passwords (because I don't want you retrieving messages yet). - exit thunderbird - from backed up profile, copy the Mail and Imapmail folders into the new profile - restart thunderbird - import old addressbook

This would require redoing any settings or addons, but it has its benefits too. I post my suggestion only because I see you've been waiting a day for a response. There is a risk, but it may work ok. Again, I wouldn't attempt this unless you can readily restore ver 38. Good luck.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David for your input, I will be taking a look probably next week when I have more free time to concentrate! Your thoughts sound good to me, thank you John
creator: jbtutoring

content:
Alternatively you can update Thunderbird progressively in stages with intermediate major versions until you get to the latest version. This is needed because Thunderbird does some "profile migration" actions between versions. You should go through the versions as follows: 38 -> 45.8.0 -> 52.9.1 -> 60.9.1 -> 68.12.1 -> 78.14.0 -> 91.13.1

Once you're at v91, do Help > About to get the latest 102 version (currently 102.7.0).

Intermediate versions are archived at https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

As Stans already pointed out, do a full backup of the Thunderbird profile prior to each step.
creator: christ1

creator: jbtutoring

content:
Non esiste un limite un numero di account che possono essere gestiti in Thunderbird. La configurazione hardware richiede invece almeno un processore di classe Pentium 4 (o equivalente) e 2 GB di RAM. Si tratta però di una configurazione minima che va alzata in caso di uso gravoso.

Setto questo, nello specifico la causa del problema potrebbe essere la dimensione dei file di archivio. Sopra una certa soglia (che dipende da caso a caso) la manipolazione dei file di archivio diventa molto gravosa e può rallentare il funzionamento del programma.

Altra causa comune è l'uso di estensioni che alterano il funzionamento di Thunderbird.
creator: @next

content: Just a suggestion: when posting a problem, share the exact message that you receive and from whom, when known. Also, explain whether this is a new situation, or whether it's just specific emails. And also share if you've just made changes. For example, recently a person's email was being marked as spam because the newly installed antivirus program was inserting an advertisement at bottom of messages.

Pair your mobile browser with Firefox desktop Tap the menu button. Tap Settings. Tap Synchronise and save your data. Tap Scan pairing code in desktop Firefox. Access firefox.com/pair on your desktop. Tap Ready to scan at the bottom of the Synchronise and save your data screen within Firefox for Android app.

Regards, Will

content:
When you start Thunderbird for the first time, or select File > New > Get a New Mail Account, you are given the option to acquire an entirely new email account from an email service provider. Enter the name you want to use for your new email address in the field at the top, select the desired provider and click Search.

Regards, Will

content:
Turn on Account Linking Start in the account that will become the primary account. In the top right corner of the browser, select the "Settings" icon. Under “Quick Settings” select "See all settings" Select the fourth tab from the left, titled "Accounts" In the "Send mail as:" section, select “Add another email address”

Regards, Will

content:
Your image looks like the emails might exist as there are dates and other indicators like empty stars.

The image also shows the Folder Pane and the folders look like typical POP account folders. eg: 'Junk' Is this a POP or IMAP mail account ?

We need to find out what you have got stored in your profile.

Please supply the following info:

  • Menu icon > Help > More Troubleshooting Information.
  • Under 'Application Basics' - half way - Profile Folder - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder. All POP accounts will be listed in the 'Mail' folder. All IMAP accounts are listed in the 'ImapMail' folder

  • Click on 'Mail' (or 'ImapMail' if imap)
  • click on the mail account name folder for problem account.
  • make sure you have the 'View' tab showing 'Details' eg: columns - name, size, type, modified date
  • Make sure this checkbox is selected: File name extensions
  • Post an image jpg file showing the contents.
creator: Toad-Hall
